channel.title: Composite Sounds on Fugalist
channel.description: Recent content in Composite Sounds on Fugalist

item.description: Fields # Name # Give your composite sound a name. Condition # The condition determines which branch of the composite sound to use for a particular note. In the example above, the first branch is used if the note length (as computed by Dorico) is less than short. The second branch is used otherwise. That means that short notes will use your staccato patch, and longer notes use the sustain patch.

Condition Syntax # Fugalist is pretty flexible about how to write conditions. You can use comparison operators to combine the actual note length (NoteLength) and Dorico’s predefined note lengths. Examples of simple comparisons: NoteLength <= veryShort note length <= very short very short < note length Dorico’s predefined note lengths: very short 0.1875 seconds, or a dotted 16th note at 120bpm short 0.375 seconds, or a dotted 8th note at 120bpm medium 0.
